snippet: In a radio address broadcast nationally, Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China delivered this surprising comment: "Frankly, our banks make profits far too easily. Why? Because a small number of major banks occupy a monopoly position, meaning one can...
abstract: In a radio address broadcast nationally, Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China delivered this surprising comment: "Frankly, our banks make profits far too easily. Why? Because a small number of major banks occupy a monopoly position, meaning one can only go to them for loans and capital."

headline.main: Chinese Leader Says Banks Are Too Powerful
